intro: Cynoglossospermum spathulatum, commonly known as the broadleaf sida, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, showing adaptability to dry environments. It has a hairy stem and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. This species is often found in disturbed soils and can be a pioneer plant in certain ecological settings.
